name: Barbarian
description:
In this game you play the role of a barbarian who must navigate his way through dangerous dungeons. The game is played from a third person side scrolling perspective and also has platform jumping parts to it. The barbarian is controlled by using left and right on the joystick to move and up and down is used to scroll through the various commands at the bottom of the screen.
When a command is highlighted pressing fire will perform that action thus saving on extra buttons being needed to play. There are two weapons at your disposal. A sword which you start the game with and later a bow which is handy for long range attacks. There are many traps to avoid and various monsters who have different attack patterns.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, iPad, iPhone, MSX | Combined View

shot.caption: The first enemy that you encounter leaps at you when you get near so timing your attack correctly is crucial
When you kill an enemy they turn into a cloud with a skull and cross bones symbol
If you move too slowly the spike trap will get you
These half man half pig creatures are quite slow moving
The bridge will fall away from you if you walk on it
You also come up against human enemies this one is heavily Armoured
Your character is quite athletic and can perform back and forward flips to help him get out of harms way
These phantom like creatures can shoot fireballs at you
There are many ladders to climb in the game
The bow comes in handy for long distance attacking
These rabid hounds have saliva dripping from their mouths and can run very fast
These phantoms can lunge at you as well as throw fireballs.
Running off that edge would be suicide.
The sorcerer type enemies throw even faster fireballs that the phantom ones
